DataElement.preferredName: General Surgical Complication Musculoskeletal and Dermatological Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the kind of  musculoskeletal and dermatological related to surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Generalized Surgical Procedure Complication Musculoskeletal And Dermatologic System
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Widespread, broadly dispersed, common._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure._Pertaining to the muscles and skeleton._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Having to do with the skin, relating to or practicing dermatology._A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Widespread, broadly dispersed, common.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with muscles, bones, tendons, ligaments, joints, and cartilage.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Having to do with the skin, relating to or practicing dermatology.:a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the muscles and skeleton.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Having to do with the skin.
A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Princess Margaret as requested by D.Laurence. mc 6/15/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring during the course of a surgical procedure.: A traumatic injury involving interruption of tissue cohesiveness that results from exposure to caustic chemicals, extreme heat, extreme cold or excessive radiation.

Concepts.definition: Occurring during the course of a surgical procedure.
A traumatic injury involving interruption of tissue cohesiveness that results from exposure to caustic chemicals, extreme heat, extreme cold or excessive radiation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Death of tissue due to external pressure.

Concepts.definition: Death of tissue due to external pressure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An inflammatory process affecting the skin. Signs include red rash, itching, and blister formation. Representative examples are contact dermatitis, atopic dermatitis, and seborrheic dermatitis.: Any change in the skin which affects its appearance or texture. A rash may be localized to one part of the body, or affect all the skin. Rashes may cause the skin to change color, itch, become warm, bumpy, dry, cracked or blistered, swell and may be painful.

Concepts.definition: An inflammatory process affecting the skin. Signs include red rash, itching, and blister formation. Representative examples are contact dermatitis, atopic dermatitis, and seborrheic dermatitis.

Any change in the skin which affects its appearance or texture. A rash may be localized to one part of the body, or affect all the skin. Rashes may cause the skin to change color, itch, become warm, bumpy, dry, cracked or blistered, swell and may be painful.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A traumatic injury to the bone in which the continuity of the bone is broken.

Concepts.definition: A traumatic injury to the bone in which the continuity of the bone is broken.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
